title: Long Division
text: Write it as a long division problem.\nBe sure the dividend is in standard form.
speech: Write it as a long division problem.\nBe sure the dividend is in standard form.

title: Long Division
text: Divide $$x^2$$ by $$x$$. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I need\nto multiply $$x$$ by to get x**2?”

title: Long Division
text: Put the answer, $$x$$, in the quotient over the $$x$$ term.\nMultiply $$x$$ times $$x+5$$. Line up the like terms under the dividend.
speech: Put the answer,  x , in the quotient over the  x  term.\nMultiply  x  times  x plus 5 . Line up the like terms under the dividend.

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$x^2+5x$$ from $$x^2+9x$$.\nYou may find it easier to change the signs and then add.\nThen bring down the last term, $$20$$.
speech: Subtract  x squared plus, 5 x  from  x squared plus 9 x .\nYou may find it easier to change the signs and then add.\nThen bring down the last term,  20 .

title: Long Division
text: Divide $$4x$$ by $$x$$. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I\nneed to multiply $$x$$ by to get $$4x$$ ?”\nPut the answer, $$4$$ , in the quotient over the constant term.

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$4x+20$$ from $$4x+20$$. We get $$0$$ so there is no remainder.
speech: Subtract  4 x plus 20  from  4 x, plus 20 . We get  0  so there is no remainder.
